New Records: Jarrett Allen scored a season-high 27 points.
Austin Reaves had a season-high 35 points with 10 assists and nine rebounds.
Cleveland Cavaliers set a new record with 18 three-pointers made in the game.
Key Match Events: Cleveland led 96-80 less than three minutes into the fourth quarter before Los Angeles started to rally.
The Lakers got within 112-107 before the Cavaliers closed the game on a 10-3 run.
Jarrett Allen's dunk with 1:58 remaining gave Cleveland a 116-107 advantage.
Pre-Game Insights: LeBron James played his first game since turning 40.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sam Merrill sprained his right ankle during the second quarter and did not return.
Darius Garland had a season-high 14 assists.
Dorian Finney-Smith and Shake Milton made their Los Angeles debuts.
Others: Cleveland Cavaliers have a 9-0 record against the Western Conference this season.
Los Angeles Lakers are seventh in the Western Conference with an 18-14 record.
